intro: Prestonia tysonii, commonly known as the Trinidadian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands, particularly Trinidad and Tobago. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered an endangered species.
